Detailed Description

Class which wraps DirectX support for rendering fonts.

The class is based off of code found in Jim Adams' Programming Role Playing Games with DirectX.

Member Function Documentation

BOOL Font::Create ( GraphicsCore *  Graphics,
char *  Name,
long  Size,
BOOL  Bold = FALSE,
BOOL  Italic = FALSE 
)

Creates the specified font.

Parameters:
Graphics GraphicsCore object to attach the font.
Name Name of the font. These include "Times New Roman" and "Courier"
Size Point size of the font.
Bold TRUE if the font is bold (default false).
Italic TRUE if the font is italic (default false).
Underline TRUE if the font is underlined (default false).
Returns:
TRUE if the font is created successfully.

BOOL Font::Print ( char *  Text,
long  XPos,
long  YPos,
long  Width,
long  Height,
D3DCOLOR  Color = 0xFFFFFFFF,
DWORD  Format = 0 
)

Prints Text to the screen in a textbox (not the class Textbox), using the font's properties.

Parameters:
Text text to print.
XPos x-coordinate that represents the upper-left corner of the textbox.
YPos y-coordinate that represents the upper-left corner of the textbox.
Width Width of the textbox.
Height Height of the textbox.
Color Color of the printed text. (D3DCOLOR expects an 8 bit hex number).
Format Format of the printed font. This is achieved via flags, which can be combined using bitwise OR Some of the more useful ones include: DT_WORDBREAK DT_BOTTOM DT_CENTER DT_LEFT DT_RIGHT DT_TOP
Returns:
TRUE if printing is successful.
